partintro.para: This module provides semaphore functions using System V semaphores. Semaphores may be used to provide exclusive access to resources on the current machine, or to limit the number of processes that may simultaneously use a resource.

This module provides also shared memory functions using System V shared memory. Shared memory may be used to provide access to global variables. Different httpd-daemons and even other programs (such as Perl, C, ...) are able to access this data to provide a global data-exchange. Remember, that shared memory is NOT safe against simultaneous access. Use semaphores for synchronization.
Limits of Shared Memory by the Unix OS
SHMMAX max size of shared memory, normally 131072 bytes
SHMMIN minimum size of shared memory, normally 1 byte
SHMMNI
max amount of shared memory segments on a system, normally 100
SHMSEG
max amount of shared memory segments per process, normally 6

note.simpara: These functions do not work on Windows systems.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns: A positive semaphore identifier on success, or FALSE on error.

Sem_get returns an id that can be used to access the System V semaphore with the given key. The semaphore is created if necessary using the permission bits specified in perm (defaults to 0666). The number of processes that can acquire the semaphore simultaneously is set to max_acquire (defaults to 1). Actually this value is set only if the process finds it is the only process currently attached to the semaphore.
A second call to sem_get for the same key will return a different semaphore identifier, but both identifiers access the same underlying semaphore.
See also: sem_acquire and sem_release.

note.simpara: This function does not work on Windows systems.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns: TRUE on success, FALSE on error.

Sem_acquire blocks (if necessary) until the semaphore can be acquired. A process attempting to acquire a semaphore which it has already acquired will block forever if acquiring the semaphore would cause its max_acquire value to be exceeded.
After processing a request, any semaphores acquired by the process but not explicitly released will be released automatically and a warning will be generated.
See also: sem_get and sem_release.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns: TRUE on success, FALSE on error.
Sem_release releases the semaphore if it is currently acquired by the calling process, otherwise a warning is generated.
After releasing the semaphore, sem_acquire may be called to re-acquire it.
See also: sem_get and sem_acquire.

note.simpara: This function does not work on Windows systems.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns: TRUE on success, FALSE on error.
Sem_remove removes the semaphore sem_identifier if it has been created by sem_get, otherwise generates a warning.
After removing the semaphore, it is no more accessible.
See also: sem_get, sem_release and sem_acquire.

note.simpara: This function does not work on Windows systems. It was added on PHP 4.0.7.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Creates or open a shared memory segment

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Shm_attach returns an id that that can be used to access the System V shared memory with the given key, the first call creates the shared memory segment with mem_size (default: sysvshm.init_mem in the configuration file, otherwise 10000 bytes) and the optional perm-bits (default: 0666).
A second call to shm_attach for the same key will return a different shared memory identifier, but both identifiers access the same underlying shared memory. Memsize and perm will be ignored.

note.simpara: This function does not work on Windows systems.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Shm_detach disconnects from the shared memory given by the shm_identifier created by shm_attach. Remember, that shared memory still exist in the Unix system and the data is still present.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Removes shared memory from Unix systems

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Removes shared memory from Unix systems. All data will be destroyed.

note.simpara: This function does not work on Windows systems.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Inserts or updates a variable in shared memory

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Inserts or updates a variable with a given variable_key. All variable-types (double, int, string, array) are supported.

note.simpara: This function does not work on Windows systems.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns a variable from shared memory

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Shm_get_var returns the variable with a given variable_key. The variable is still present in the shared memory.

note.simpara: This function does not work on Windows systems.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Removes a variable from shared memory

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Removes a variable with a given variable_key and frees the occupied memory.

note.simpara: This function does not work on Windows systems.
